intro: Meconopsis bella, commonly known as the Himalayan blue poppy, is a striking alpine flowering plant native to the Himalayas. The plant belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppies and related species. Meconopsis bella typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces delicate, showy flowers in late spring. Due to its habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its native range.
